User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user account in the EOD 終端機 application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

roleName.description: The unique role name chosen by the user.

plurkInfo.description: User's Plurk information (e.g., username, profile URL).

characterSheetUrl.description: URL to the character sheet image.

avatarUrl.description: URL to the user's avatar image.

factionId.description: The ID of the faction the user belongs to.

raceId.description: The ID of the race of the user's character.

registrationDate.description: Date and time the user registered.

approved.description: Indicates whether the user's account has been approved by an administrator.

titles.description: An array of titles the character has earned.

equipment.description: An array of equipment IDs the character has equipped.

items.description: An array of item IDs the character possesses.

tasks.description: An array of task IDs the character has submitted.

submittedMainQuest.description: Flag indicating if the user has submitted the main quest task.

Character.title: Character
Character.description: Represents a character within the EOD 終端機 application, associated with a user.

userId.description: Reference to the User who owns this character. (Relationship: User 1:N Character)

factionId.description: Reference to the Faction the character belongs to. (Relationship: Faction 1:N Character)

raceId.description: Reference to the Race of the character. (Relationship: Race 1:N Character)

equipmentIds.description: References to the Equipment the character has. (Relationship: Character N:N Equipment)

Faction.title: Faction
Faction.description: Represents a faction within the EOD 終端機 application.

score.description: The current score of the faction.

Race.title: Race
Race.description: Represents a race within the EOD 終端機 application.

hp.description: Base hit points for the race.

atk.description: Base attack power for the race.

def.description: Base defense power for the race.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task submitted by a user.

userId.description: Reference to the User who submitted the task.

userName.description: The name of the user who submitted the task.

userFactionId.description: The faction of the user who submitted the task.

taskTypeId.description: Reference to the TaskType of the task.

title.description: The title or description of the submission.

submissionUrl.description: URL where the task submission can be found.

honorPointsAwarded.description: Honor points awarded for the task.

submissionDate.description: Date and time the task was submitted.

status.description: The review status of the task.

factionContribution.description: For Wanderers, which faction this task contributed to.

TaskType.title: TaskType
TaskType.description: Represents a type of task that can be submitted.

id.description: Unique identifier for the task type.

name.description: The name of the task type.

description.description: A description of the task type.

honorPoints.description: Honor points awarded for this task type.

currency.description: Currency awarded for this task type.

titleAwarded.description: The title ID awarded for completing this task type (optional).

itemAwarded.description: The item ID awarded for completing this task type (optional).

requiresApproval.description: Indicates if a task of this type requires admin approval before rewards are given.

singleSubmission.description: Indicates if a user can only submit a task of this type once.

Item.title: Item
Item.description: Represents an item in the game.

itemTypeId.description: Reference to the ItemType of the item.

factionId.description: Reference to the Faction that this item belongs to. Required for store items.

raceId.description: Race restriction for the item. Can be 'all' for no restriction.

effects.description: Structured description of the item's effects.

isPublished.description: If true, the item will appear in the faction store.

id.description: Unique identifier for the item type.

name.description: The name of the item type.

description.description: A description of the item type.

Equipment.title: Equipment
Equipment.description: Represents a piece of equipment a character can equip.

attributes.description: The attributes that the equipment provides to the character.

CombatLog.title: CombatLog
CombatLog.description: Represents log data for a combat encounter.

id.description: Unique identifier for the combat log.

combatEncounterId.description: Reference to the CombatEncounter. (Relationship: CombatEncounter 1:N CombatLog)

logData.description: A string containing log data about the combat encounter.

timestamp.description: The time the log entry was recorded.

CombatEncounter.title: CombatEncounter
CombatEncounter.description: Represents an instance of a combat encounter.

id.description: Unique identifier for the combat encounter.

startTime.description: The time the combat encounter started.

endTime.description: The time the combat encounter ended.

Title.title: Title
Title.description: Represents a title or achievement a user can earn.

description.description: A description of how to earn the title.

isHidden.description: Indicates whether the title is hidden until earned.

CharacterTitle.title: CharacterTitle
CharacterTitle.description: Links characters to their earned titles.

characterId.description: Reference to the Character. (Relationship: Character N:N Title)

titleId.description: Reference to the Title. (Relationship: Character N:N Title)

obtainedDate.description: The date the title was obtained.

Skill.title: Skill
Skill.description: Represents a skill a character can use.

description.description: A description of the skill's effects.

factionId.description: Reference to the Faction that can use the skill, can be null for all faction skills.(Relationship: Faction 1:N Skill)

raceId.description: Reference to the Race that can use the skill, can be null for all race skills.(Relationship: Race 1:N Skill)

cooldown.description: The number of turns before the skill can be used again.

effects.description: Structured description of the skill's effects.

ActivityLog.title: ActivityLog
ActivityLog.description: Represents a log entry for a character's activity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the log entry.

userId.description: The ID of the user this log belongs to.

timestamp.description: Date and time the activity occurred.

change.description: A summary of the change, e.g., '+100 Honor Points'.

CraftRecipe.title: CraftRecipe
CraftRecipe.description: Defines a crafting recipe for combining items.

baseItemId.description: The ID of the base item (usually equipment).

materialItemId.description: The ID of the material item (usually a special item).

resultItemId.description: The ID of the resulting crafted item.

isPublished.description: If true, the recipe will appear in the crafting reference list.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes security, scalability, and debuggability, following the core design principles and strategy mandates. It emphasizes authorization independence, clarity of intent, and avoids custom claims (DBAC). The structure is designed to support secure `list` operations (QAPs) and maintain data integrity. 

**Authorization Independence:**
To ensure authorization independence, the structure denormalizes authorization context where necessary. For example, if `Character` access depended on `Faction` attributes, those attributes would be copied into every `Character` document.

**Structural Segregation:**
The design segregates data based on security requirements. User-specific data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, while global data like `Factions` and `Races` reside in root-level collections. This simplifies security rules by ensuring that each collection has a homogeneous security posture. The global `tasks` collection is introduced for easy querying of all submissions by admins and for the public feed.

**Access Modeling:**
*   **Private Data:** User-owned data (e.g., Characters, ActivityLogs) is stored under `/users/{userId}` to leverage path-based ownership. This allows simple and efficient security rules based on `request.auth.uid`.
*   **Collaborative Data:** The global `/tasks` collection is readable by all but can only be created by authenticated users, supporting a public submission feed.
*   **Global Roles (DBAC):** Admin roles are managed through the existence of documents in dedicated collections (e.g., `/roles_admin/{uid}`).

**QAPs Support:**
The structure supports secure `list` operations (QAPs) by:

*   Segregating data with different access needs into separate collections. For instance, admin-only data is stored separately from user-owned data.
*   Using path-based ownership for user-specific data, which allows listing only resources owned by the authenticated user.

**Invariants:**
The structure supports data integrity through the use of ownership, timestamps, and denormalized data. Security rules can enforce constraints on these fields to maintain data consistency.
